thig15.1:31.4: “Twice-born” is an epithet of brahmins, referring to material and spiritual births. That it does refer to brahmins is established by the fact that it is paired with _samaṇa_, an extremely pervasive duo. It is normally found only in later literature, and this might be the first recorded usage of the idiom.
thig15.1:43.3: The text is literally “neither woman nor man”. The preceding verses speak repeatedly of castration, making it clear that this means having no genitals, rather than simply being a person who is non-binary.
